title: High School Drivers
question_text: In a large metropolitan area, the proportion of high school seniors who drive to school at least $3\text{ days a week}$ is $0.45$ . A random sample of $25\text{ students}$ is chosen. How would you calculate the probability that at least $13$ of these students drive to school at least $3\text{ days a week}$ ?

choices.text: Use the multiplication rule for probabilities for the following item from the sample space, where D D = drives and N N = does not drive: D D D D D D D D D D D D D N N N N N N N N N N N N D D D D D D D D D D D D D N N N N N N N N N N N N
